labels.analysis: The Tibber MCP Server is designed to provide real-time energy consumption data and pricing information, allowing AI agents to analyze power usage patterns and costs. The tools available enable retrieval of current pricing, home energy details, and past consumption data over a 30-day period. This server helps users make informed decisions about energy usage based on real-time and historical data.
labels.reasoning: The server's primary function is centered around energy data analysis and pricing insights, which aligns well with the "Data Analysis & Processing" category. Its tools facilitate the gathering and interpretation of energy consumption trends, making it a valuable resource for cost optimization and energy management.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Tibber MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @linkcd/tibber-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect your AI agent to real-time energy consumption data and pricing from Tibber. Analyze your power usage, discover patterns, and get insights into energy costs effortlessly. Empower your decisions with instant access to your energy data and pricing forecasts.

tools.name: get_price_and_home_info

tools.name: get_consumption_data
tools.description: Get the hourly consumption data for the last 30 days, such as time period, total cost, base energy cost, and consumpted kwh.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@linkcd/tibber-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
